page.title: 07INDUSTRY IN BREICH VALLEY
page.content: The largest employers in the area are both in Addiewell.Richard Lees is a{concrete factory}which employs 30_40 people.It occupies a large part of the former Addiewell oil works.There has been a concrete factory on the site for many years but the name keeps changing due to takeovers. A large area of ground is used by the Distillers Company as a{bonded {warehouse}for whisky.This is where whisky is kept until it matures.There is tight security at the bond because of the value of the whisky and to make sure that there are no fires. Again in Addiewell the British Steel Corporation own{a pipe storage depot.The old Addiewell School building has been converted into{small {business units}while the old Stoneyburn School is now{M.S.C. {workshops.
